revised_title: Exploring the Minute Structure and Nerve Function of the Frog and Toad Tongue
tldr: The author investigates the minute structure and nerve function of the frog and toad tongue using microscopy and ether anesthesia. The study reveals the presence of vibratile cilia, fungiform and conical papillae, and the distribution of nerves and blood vessels in these organs, providing insights into their sensory functions.
